article.headline: Fairfield 82, Iona 57
article.story: BRIDGEPORT, Conn. (AP) -- Rob Thomson scored 15 of his game-high 21 points in the first half as Fairfield beat Iona 82-57 in a Metro Atlantic Athletic Conference game Thursday. Fairfield (17-9, 10-5) closed the first half on an 18-2 run to open up a 39-25 lead at the break. The lead stretched to as many as 31 in the second half after an 11-1 spurt. Fairfield has won two straight games and eight of nine. The Stags are tied with Niagara for third place in the MAAC. Iona (7-17, 5-9) has lost its last five and eight of 10. Thomson added 14 rebounds and five assists for Fairfield. DeWitt Maxwell scored 13. Ricky Soliver scored 18 for Iona, including 12 in the first half, and Steve Burtt added 10. Fairfield shot 54.7 percent from the floor and had 18 assists to just eight turnovers.
